content.question: If f is a continuous function on the closed interval [a, b], which of the following must be true?

choices.label: There is a number c in the open interval (a, b) such that f (c) = 0.
There is a number c in the open interval (a, b) such that f (a) < f (c) < f (b).
There is a number c in the closed interval [a, b] such that f (c) ≥ f (x) for all x in [a, b].

There is a number c in the open interval (a, b) such that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>c</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E63@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

There is a number c in the open interval (a b) such that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>c</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>b</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>b</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mi>a</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4891@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

content.answer: There is a number c in the closed interval [a, b] such that f (c) ≥ f (x) for all x in [a, b].

topic.text: 5.2: Extreme Value Theorem, Global Versus Local Extrema, and Critical Points

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
